definitions.definition: A small furrow, ridge or crease in an otherwise smooth surface.
A line or crease in the skin, especially when caused by age or fatigue.
definitions.example: Spending time out in the sun may cause you to develop wrinkles sooner.

definitions.definition: A fault, imperfection or bug especially in a new system or product; typically, they will need to be ironed out.
definitions.example: Three months later, we're still discovering new wrinkles.

definitions.definition: A twist on something existing; a novel difference.
To make wrinkles in; to cause to have wrinkles.
definitions.example: Be careful not to wrinkle your dress before we arrive.

definitions.definition: To pucker or become uneven or irregular.
definitions.example: An hour in the tub will cause your fingers to wrinkle.

definitions.definition: (of skin) To develop irreversibly wrinkles; to age.
definitions.example: The skin is the substance that wrinkles, shows age, stretches, scars and cuts.
